timeline.message:
Remove ACL checks from the GET endpoints of Search settings
and Classifications.

Changes for PagedResults.scala

1. When resumption token is generated, required ACLs for
accessing entities should be taken into account.
2. The number of maximum entities retrieved in one request
is fixed to 200.
3. Simplify method 'collectMore' and rename some variables
and methods to improve readability.

Make 'commentCount' of interface 'SearchResultItem'
optional.

Without permissions, one cannot get an item's comments
so this field should be optional.
Add a new method to get comments with ACL checks.

Update Search2 endpoint for permission checks.

Permission COMMENT_VIEW_ITEM should be checked before
getting an item's comments. If the permission is granted
then the number of comments is included in the response.
Remove a line of useless statement in SearchResource.scala.
Add comments in PagedResults.scala.

timeline.bodyText: After removing amountToTry, moving nextLot and privMap to the object level  and renaming them, this method looks easier to read and understand to me, but I have not worked out how to properly move ExtraPrivs outside.
timeline.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.bodyText:
I wonder if peope are confused about the use of drop so let me give an example.
Say there are 15 available entities. The initial token is 0:10, which means offset is 0 and length is 10. So the first response include the first 10 entities.  And then, the secdon token must be 10:10. Because we already have the first 10 entities, we drop them and only get 11th - 15th entities.
timeline.author: PenghaiZhang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,53 +58,55 @@ object PagedResults {
 
     val allReqPriv = if (full) forFull ++ privilege else privilege
 
+    // All Collections, including dynamic Collections.
+    val baseEntities = res.getEntityService.query(
+      new EnumerateOptions(q, -1, MaxEntities, system, if (includeDisabled) null else false))
+    // A list of Collections which users have permissions to access.
+    val availableEntities = baseEntities.asScala.collect {
+      case be if !LegacyGuice.aclManager.filterNonGrantedPrivileges(be, privilege.asJava).isEmpty =>
+        be
+    }
+    // Return a map where the key is a base entity and the value is a another map for the entity's ACLs.
+    // Depending on the value of offset, some available entities are not added into the map.
+    def getPrivilegeMap(offset: Int): Map[BE, java.util.Map[String, java.lang.Boolean]] =
+      LegacyGuice.aclManager
+        .getPrivilegesForObjects(allReqPriv.asJavaCollection, availableEntities.drop(offset).asJava)

timeline.bodyText: Strange that to get a count of the number of comments, we first go and retrieve all the comments from the DB. This is unnecessary load on the DB, normally you'd just do a count query. I note however that the Service currently lacks such a method. Might be good to keep the new methods you have - as we'll need them later - but maybe we should do this properly with a DB call.

timeline.message:
Fix two issues of PagedResults.scala

1. Remove the use of -1 as offset for retrieving entities
so that all entities are retrievable.
2. Rework how to generate resumption tokens and when they
should be returned.
Properly get the count of item's comments.
Remove useless comments for PagedResults.scala.

timeline.bodyText: I did not create a new method for comment count. Instead, I reused itemDao.getCommentCounts like how old search page uses it.
timeline.author: PenghaiZhang

replies.bodyText: Good find, I see it's doing a HQL count(), so that's perfect. 👍
replies.author: edalex-ian

timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: We may want to make a comment here to highlight we're retrieving all. But this is done in a considered way that the targetted BaseEntities are all small datasets.

timeline.bodyText:
I find it kinda wierd how we're relying on always getting MaxEntities (rather than say length) and then hoping we can prune it down. Rather then getting length entities, and topping it up with more queries as needed.
Feels like there's a chance that MaxEntities could potentially fail to have enough, and then we'd fall short. But maybe that's an extreme edge case. Or... Maybe I'm also mis-understanding something here. (I don't find collectMore that readable.)

timeline.message:
Add comment to explain why retrieve all entities for
resumption tokens.
Collection base entities with the specified length.
Tweaks for how to get the comment count.
Rewrite the method to retrieve entities with permissions.
Tidy ups for PagedResults.scala

Add a new Collection to testing Institution 'rest'
and revoke the permission to access this Collection.
Use ID as PageListCallback's sorting order.
Create a test for a range of base entity endpoints.
Add BaseEntityAPITest to Codebuild configuration file.
Merge branch 'component/new-search-page' into bugfix/search-page-acl-issues

timeline.message:
Improve the comments in PagedResults.scala.

Co-authored-by: edalex-ian <43919233+edalex-ian@users.noreply.github.com>
Support getting full information of base entity.

Update testing Institution 'rest'

Revoke permission 'EDIT_COLLECTION' from one
Collection.
Add a test for getting full details of base entity.
Remove HQL 'order by' for counting the number of Portlets.

timeline.bodyText:
Here is why PortletTest failed. The callback passed in this method is essentially a PagedListCallback so an order by will be appended to the HQL, which resulted in Postgresl error [42803]: column "be.id" must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be used in an aggregate function Position: 42  .
However, this method is used to count the number of Portlets. There is no point to do a sorting. So I believe we should remove this if statement. One good example is method createEnumerateQuery from GenericInstitionalDaoImpl.
timeline.author: PenghaiZhang

replies.bodyText:
I agree.
This is odd it's doing an order for a count. I wonder if it's a case of copy pasta. 🤔
replies.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: Maybe expand this out then to highlight what the significance of then checking for security is. (As personally, I'm not sure what the point is...)
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText: You should update getResultLength to also use this new method.
timeline.author: edalex-ian

timeline.bodyText:
The addition of this tuple ((BE, Boolean, Set[String])) is getting a bit obtuse. Especially when the return of the method is now a tuple which includes a List which contains a tuple which also includes a Set. (I think that mouthful highlights the situation.)
I wonder if a case class may be in order for the inner tuple of (BE, Boolean, Set[String]). 🤔
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: It's a very good idea to use a case class here!
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.message: Improvements for BaseEntityAPITest

Create a case class to help improve the readability
of PagedResults.

replies.bodyText: Hi Christian, this xml file is from an Institution export and in the format oEQ expects.
